note: First conversation via referral. Client based in Bengaluru, India; resident. Prefers WhatsApp over calls; okay for quick calls on weekday evenings; language English. Married with one child (~6); spouse involved in big decisions. Works in IT as a Product Director at a mid/large tech company; income largely stable salary plus annual bonus; approx 50L–1Cr. Monthly expenses roughly 2–5L; investable surplus 1–3L and wants more discipline. Emergency buffer about 3–6 months (not fully sure). Has a home loan; EMI manageable; did not share outstanding yet. Primary goals are child education and long-term wealth creation (10y+ horizons). No immediate large liquidity needs; may upgrade car in 12–18 months but not committed. Prefers SIP plus occasional lump sum; comfortable with equity and mutual funds with some debt for stability; dislikes complicated products and long lock-ins unless clearly justified; high tax sensitivity. Past experience with a bank RM felt pushy (NFOs/insurance); wants transparency and fewer products. Wants clean summaries with charts and short writeups; decision speed medium and needs spouse buy-in. Risk behavior: held through 2020 drawdown without selling; self-described moderate pending questionnaire. PAN/KYC not shared in first call but open to share later. Next follow-up planned for 2026-01-08 to send risk questionnaire, request PAN, map current holdings at high level, and propose a starter SIP framework.

Inbound lead met in person. Client based in Delhi NCR; resident. Prefers calls and dislikes long WhatsApp threads; prefers mornings; language Hindi/English mix. Married with two dependents (kids in middle school) and supports parents in a joint family setup. Owns a manufacturing/distribution SME; income 2Cr+ but variable and seasonal; primary income from business, secondary some rent. Expects a commercial property sale in 3–6 months and wants to plan deployment without locking everything up. Liquidity needs within 12 months due to working-capital cycles; wants flexibility. Expenses 5L+; investable surplus inconsistent (good vs lean months). Emergency buffer under 3 months as cash kept in business. Has business loan and credit cards; did not disclose exact numbers yet but says manageable. Goals: preserve capital for part of corpus and grow long-term; mentions possible kids’ foreign education but not decided. Explicitly wants no lock-ins and no ULIPs; open to bonds/FDs for parking and some equity but wants to avoid volatility surprises; interested in gold as a hedge; international exposure maybe later. Trust concerns: currently has CA and local advisor and feels advice is fragmented; wants one-point accountability but will test trust first. Decisioning: quick if trust is built; wants simple summaries, not long decks; prefers ad-hoc touchpoints only when needed. KYC in progress; PAN to be shared via assistant; tax residency India. Next follow-up planned for 2026-01-06 to create a three-bucket plan (parking/near-term flexible/long-term growth), confirm approximate liability structure, and start KYC checklist.

First video call after meeting at an event. Client currently in Dubai (UAE) and is an NRI. Prefers email for official documentation and WhatsApp for quick coordination; prefers weekends or late evenings IST; language English. Married, no kids yet; considering starting a family next year. Works in a professional law/consulting role in a BFSI-adjacent setting; stable income ~1–2Cr equivalent. Potential move back to India in ~12 months (not final) and considering home purchase after relocation. Liquidity horizon 1–3 years for down payment and relocation costs. Keeps 6–12 months emergency buffer; monthly expenses 2–5L; investable surplus 1–3L; no major liabilities mentioned. Goals: home purchase plus long-term wealth creation with accessibility for relocation. Prefers SIP discipline but wants flexible contributions; prefers mutual funds plus bonds/FDs; wants to avoid anything that complicates NRI compliance. High tax sensitivity; specifically asked about taxation differences, repatriation, and documentation. Past issue with overseas advisor churning funds; wants low churn and clear rationale. Decision style is data-heavy with scenarios and assumptions; slower decision speed and wants time to read. Self-described conservative but held equity through 2022 without panic; wants formal risk questionnaire alignment. Will share PAN later and wants clear NRI document checklist; tax residency abroad (UAE). Next follow-up planned for 2026-01-10 to send NRI checklist, risk questionnaire, and propose a 12–24 month liquidity-first plan for a return-to-India scenario.

First formal profiling call (existing social relationship). Client based in Mumbai; resident. Prefers WhatsApp for quick pings and calls for decisions; prefers afternoons. Married; spouse is a co-decision-maker for large allocations. Self-employed/business owner in real estate (development and leasing); income 2Cr+ but lumpy/deal-based. Expects potential large inflow from a project exit in ~6–9 months (not guaranteed) and wants options lined up early. Expenses 5L+; surplus varies; says emergency buffer is ample but did not quantify; keeps cash and liquid funds. Has multiple liabilities including project loans; did not want details on first call; says manageable. Goals include wealth creation and creating passive income streams; curious about succession structuring but not urgent. Comfortable with lock-ins if compensated; open to AIF/PMS and select structured ideas but wants transparency and no opaque terms; moderate-to-high interest in international exposure. Wants to avoid traditional insurance pitches. Prefers large selective lump sums (25L+); SIP not relevant. Decisioning: wants RM to curate and provide a crisp thesis; fast decisions if trust is high. Switching from previous advisor due to perceived in-house product pushing. Risk behavior: tends to add during drawdowns; dislikes surprises from hidden liquidity or terms. PAN/KYC not shared today; will share via office; KYC not started formally. Next follow-up planned for 2026-01-07 to explain AIF/PMS basics and term-sheet red flags, begin KYC, and confirm liquidity preference bands and constraints.

First call after cold outreach conversion. Client based in Pune; resident. Prefers calls and uses WhatsApp only for confirmations; prefers mornings; language Marathi/English. Widowed with one adult child abroad; child is consulted but not primary decision-maker. Retired (former government/education administration); income from pension and interest; estimated annual income 10–25L based on description. Monthly expenses in <50k–1L range; small investable surplus 25k–50k plus an existing corpus in bank FDs. Very conservative with 12+ months emergency buffer; no liabilities. Primary goals are capital preservation and monthly income comfort; also wants to earmark funds for travel/visits. High liquidity preference and does not want lock-ins. Product preference leans to FDs/bonds and conservative funds; open to mutual funds if explained simply; no ESG preference and no international exposure desired. Very trust-sensitive due to past mis-sold insurance; skeptical of market-linked products; needs education and very small first step. Needs basics on mutual funds, risk, and reading statements; prefers simple summaries and slow decision pace. Risk behavior: previously exited equity quickly during volatility; formal risk questionnaire should be handled gently. PAN/KYC status unknown; she will check and send; KYC not started. Next follow-up planned for 2026-01-09 to explain 2–3 low-risk options (FD ladder, short-duration debt, conservative hybrid), request basic KYC documents, and propose a tiny pilot allocation to build comfort.
